titles.ar: كتاب الزِّيِّ وَ التَّجَمُّلِ وَ الْمُرُوءَةِ
titles.en: The Book of Outfits and the Beautification and the Magnanimity

verses.text: مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ يَحْيَى عَنْ أَحْمَدَ بْنِ مُحَمَّدٍ عَنْ عَلِيِّ بْنِ الْحَكَمِ عَنْ عَبْدِ اللَّهِ بْنِ جُنْدَبٍ عَنْ سُفْيَانَ بْنِ السِّمْطِ قَالَ قَالَ لِي أَبُو عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) الثَّوْبُ النَّقِيُّ يَكْبِتُ الْعَدُوَّ وَ الدُّهْنُ يَذْهَبُ بِالْبُؤْسِ وَ الْمَشْطُ لِلرَّأْسِ يَذْهَبُ بِالْوَبَاءِ قَالَ قُلْتُ وَ مَا الْوَبَاءُ قَالَ الْحُمَّى وَ الْمَشْطُ لِلِّحْيَةِ يَشُدُّ الْأَضْرَاسَ .

translations.name: hubeali
translations.text: Muhammad Bin Yahya, from Ahmad Bin Muhammad, from Ali Bin Al Hakam, from Abdullah Bin Jundab, from Sufyan Bin Al Samt who said, ‘Abu Abdullahasws said to me: ‘The clean clothes suppress the enemy, and the oiling removes the anguish, and the combing for the head removes Al-Waba (illness)’. I said, ‘And what is Al-Waba?’ Heasws said: ‘The fever. And combing the beard strengthens the teeth’.

verses.text: حُمَيْدُ بْنُ زِيَادٍ عَنِ الْحَسَنِ بْنِ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ سَمَاعَةَ عَنْ أَحْمَدَ بْنِ الْحَسَنِ الْمِيثَمِيِّ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ إِسْحَاقَ عَنْ عَمَّارٍ النَّوْفَلِيِّ عَنْ أَبِيهِ قَالَ سَمِعْتُ أَبَا الْحَسَنِ ( عليه السلام ) يَقُولُ الْمَشْطُ يَذْهَبُ بِالْوَبَاءِ وَ كَانَ لِأَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) مُشْطٌ فِي الْمَسْجِدِ يَتَمَشَّطُ بِهِ إِذَا فَرَغَ مِنْ صَلَاتِهِ .

translations.name: hubeali
translations.text: Humeyd Bin Ziyad, from Al Hassan Bin Muhammad Bin Sama’at, from Ahmad Bin Al Hassan Al Maysami, form Muhammad Bin Is’haq, from Ammar Al Nowfaly, from his father who said, ‘I heard Abu Al-Hassanasws saying: ‘The combing removes the Al-Waba (fever), and for Abu Abdullahasws was a comb in the Masjid, combing with it whenever heasws was free from the Prayer’.

verses.text: عَلِيُّ بْنُ إِبْرَاهِيمَ عَنْ أَبِيهِ عَنِ ابْنِ أَبِي عُمَيْرٍ عَنِ الْحُسَيْنِ بْنِ الْحَسَنِ بْنِ عَاصِمٍ عَنْ أَبِيهِ قَالَ دَخَلْتُ عَلَى أَبِي إِبْرَاهِيمَ ( عليه السلام ) وَ فِي يَدِهِ مُشْطُ عَاجٍ يَتَمَشَّطُ بِهِ فَقُلْتُ لَهُ جُعِلْتُ فِدَاكَ إِنَّ عِنْدَنَا بِالْعِرَاقِ مَنْ يَزْعُمُ أَنَّهُ لَا يَحِلُّ التَّمَشُّطُ بِالْعَاجِ قَالَ وَ لِمَ فَقَدْ كَانَ لِأَبِي ( عليه السلام ) مِنْهَا مُشْطٌ أَوْ مُشْطَانِ ثُمَّ قَالَ تَمَشَّطُوا بِالْعَاجِ فَإِنَّ الْعَاجَ يَذْهَبُ بِالْوَبَاءِ .

translations.name: hubeali
translations.text:
Ali Bin Ibrhim, from his father, from Ibn Abu Umeyr, from Al Husayn Bin Al Hassan Bin Aasim, from his father who said, 
‘I went over to Abu Ibrahim<sup>asws</sup> (7<sup>th</sup> Imam<sup>asws</sup>), and in his<sup>asws</sup> hand was an ivory comb to comb with. So I said to him<sup>asws</sup>, ‘May I be sacrificed for you<sup>asws</sup>! There ones with us in al-Iraq who are alleging that it is not Permissible to be combing with the ivory’. He<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘And why, for there used to be, from my<sup>asws</sup> father<sup>asws</sup>, one or two ivory combs’. Then he<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘You should be combing with the ivory, for the ivory removed the illness (fever)’.

verses.text: عَلِيُّ بْنُ إِبْرَاهِيمَ عَنْ صَالِحِ بْنِ السِّنْدِيِّ عَنْ جَعْفَرِ بْنِ بَشِيرٍ عَنْ مُوسَى بْنِ بَكْرٍ قَالَ رَأَيْتُ أَبَا الْحَسَنِ ( عليه السلام ) يَتَمَشَّطُ بِمُشْطِ عَاجٍ وَ اشْتَرَيْتُهُ لَهُ .

translations.name: hubeali
translations.text:
Ali Bin Ibrahim, from Salih Bin Al Sandy, from Ja’far Bin Basheer, from Musa Bin Bakr who said, 
‘I saw Abu Al-Hassan<sup>asws</sup> combing with an ivory comb, and I had bought it for him<sup>asws</sup>’.

verses.text: الْحُسَيْنُ بْنُ مُحَمَّدٍ عَنْ مُعَلَّى بْنِ مُحَمَّدٍ عَنِ الْوَشَّاءِ عَنْ عَبْدِ اللَّهِ بْنِ سُلَيْمَانَ قَالَ سَأَلْتُ أَبَا جَعْفَرٍ ( عليه السلام ) عَنِ الْعَاجِ فَقَالَ لَا بَأْسَ بِهِ وَ إِنَّ لِي مِنْهُ لَمُشْطاً .

translations.name: hubeali
translations.text:
Al Husayn Bin Muhammad, from Moala Bin Muhammad, from Al Washa, from Abdullah Bin Suleyman who said, 
‘I asked Abu Ja’far<sup>asws</sup> about the ivory, so he<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘There is no problem with it, and there is a comb for me<sup>asws</sup>, from it (ivory)’.

verses.text: مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ يَحْيَى عَنْ أَحْمَدَ بْنِ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ عِيسَى عَنِ ابْنِ مَحْبُوبٍ عَنْ نَضْرِ بْنِ إِسْحَاقَ عَنْ عَنْبَسَةَ بْنِ سَعِيدٍ رَفَعَ الْحَدِيثَ إِلَى النَّبِيِّ ( صلى الله عليه وآله ) قَالَ كَثْرَةُ تَسْرِيحِ الرَّأْسِ تَذْهَبُ بِالْوَبَاءِ وَ تَجْلِبُ الرِّزْقَ وَ تَزِيدُ فِي الْجِمَاعِ .

translations.name: hubeali
translations.text:
Muhammad Bin Yahya, from Ahmad Bin Muhammad Bin Isa, from Ibn Mahboub, from Nazar Bin Is’haq, from Anbasa Bin Saeed, 
(It has been narrated) raising the Hadeeth to the Prophet<sup>saww</sup> having said: ‘Frequent combing of the head removes the illness (fever), and brings the livelihood, and increases in the copulation’.

verses.text: عَلِيُّ بْنُ إِبْرَاهِيمَ عَنْ أَبِيهِ عَنْ عَبْدِ اللَّهِ بْنِ الْمُغِيرَةِ عَنْ أَبِي الْحَسَنِ ( عليه السلام ) فِي قَوْلِ اللَّهِ عَزَّ وَ جَلَّ خُذُوا زِينَتَكُمْ عِنْدَ كُلِّ مَسْجِدٍ قَالَ مِنْ ذَلِكَ التَّمَشُّطُ عِنْدَ كُلِّ صَلَاةٍ .

translations.name: hubeali
translations.text: Ali Bin Ibrahim, from his father, from Abdullah Bin Al Mugheira, (It has been narrated) from Abu Al-Hassanasws regarding the Words of Allahazwj Mighty and Majestic [7:31] O Children of Adam! Take to your adornments at every Masjid. Heasws said: ‘From that is the combing at every Prayer’.

verses.text: عِدَّةٌ مِنْ أَصْحَابِنَا عَنْ أَحْمَدَ بْنِ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ خَالِدٍ عَنْ نُوحِ بْنِ شُعَيْبٍ عَنِ ابْنِ مَيَّاحٍ عَنْ يُونُسَ عَمَّنْ أَخْبَرَهُ عَنْ أَبِي الْحَسَنِ ( صلوات الله عليه ) قَالَ إِذَا سَرَّحْتَ رَأْسَكَ وَ لِحْيَتَكَ فَأَمِرَّ الْمُشْطَ عَلَى صَدْرِكَ فَإِنَّهُ يَذْهَبُ بِالْهَمِّ وَ الْوَبَاءِ .

translations.name: hubeali
translations.text:
A number of our companions, from Ahmad Bin Muhammad Bin Khalid, from Nuh Bin Shuayb, from Ibn Mayyah, from Yunus, from the one who informed him, 
(It has been narrated) from Abu Al-Hassan<sup>asws</sup> having said: ‘Whenever you comb your head and your beard, then wipe the comb upon your chest for it removes the worries and the illness (fever)’.

verses.text: عَنْهُ عَنْ أَبِيهِ قَالَ كَثْرَةُ التَّمَشُّطِ تُقَلِّلُ الْبَلْغَمَ .

translations.name: hubeali
translations.text:
From him, from his father, 
‘He<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘Frequent combing reduces the phlegm’.

verses.text: عِدَّةٌ مِنْ أَصْحَابِنَا عَنْ سَهْلِ بْنِ زِيَادٍ عَنِ الْحَسَنِ بْنِ عَطِيَّةَ عَنْ إِسْمَاعِيلَ بْنِ جَابِرٍ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( صلوات الله عليه ) قَالَ مَنْ سَرَّحَ لِحْيَتَهُ سَبْعِينَ مَرَّةً وَ عَدَّهَا مَرَّةً مَرَّةً لَمْ يَقْرَبْهُ الشَّيْطَانُ أَرْبَعِينَ يَوْماً .

translations.name: hubeali
translations.text:
A number of our companions, from Sahl Bin Ziyad, from Al Hassan Bin Atiyya, from Ismail Bin Jabir, 
(It has been narrated) from Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup> having said: ‘The one who combs his beard seventy times, and enumerates it one by one, the Satan<sup>la</sup> would not come near him for forty days’.

verses.text: مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ يَحْيَى عَنْ أَحْمَدَ بْنِ مُحَمَّدٍ عَنِ ابْنِ مَحْبُوبٍ عَنْ إِبْرَاهِيمَ بْنِ مِهْزَمٍ عَنِ الْقَاسِمِ بْنِ الْوَلِيدِ قَالَ سَأَلْتُ أَبَا عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) عَنْ عِظَامِ الْفِيلِ مَدَاهِنِهَا وَ أَمْشَاطِهَا قَالَ لَا بَأْسَ بِهَا .

translations.name: hubeali
translations.text:
Muhammad Bin Yahya, from Ahmad Bin Muhammad, from Ibn Mahboub, from Ibrahim Bin Mihzam, from Al Qasim Bin Al Waleed who said, 
‘I asked Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup> about the bones of the elephants, and their oils, and their combs. He<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘There is no problem with it’.
